summary: This bill establishes the Historic Greenwood District—Black Wall Street National Monument in Oklahoma as part of the National Park System. It aims to preserve, protect, and interpret the history of the Greenwood District, Black Wall Street, and the Tulsa Race Massacre. The bill outlines the monument's boundary, acquisition authority, administration, and the establishment of an advisory commission. It stipulates the commission's composition, duties, and operational guidelines, and addresses property rights and termination of the commission.
